alert.note: Alert for La Salle (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 25 at 2:17AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHEASTERN LA SALLE PARISH THROUGH 300 AM CDT... At 217 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm just northwest of Jena, or 20 miles west of Harrisonburg, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jena, Midway, and Nebo. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
